title: AWS Glue
description:
AWS Glue

Defines the public endpoint for the AWS Glue service.

AccessDeniedException.description: Access to a resource was denied.
AccessDeniedException.title: AccessDeniedException

Action.description: Defines an action to be initiated by a trigger.

Arguments.description: Arguments to be passed to the job.

JobName.description: The name of a job to be executed.

Action.title: Action

AlreadyExistsException.description: A resource to be created or added already exists.
AlreadyExistsException.title: AlreadyExistsException

CatalogId.description: The ID of the catalog in which the partion is to be created. Currently, this should be the AWS account ID.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the metadata database in which the partition is to be created.

PartitionInputList.description: A list of PartitionInput structures that define the partitions to be created.

TableName.description: The name of the metadata table in which the partition is to be created.

Errors.description: Errors encountered when trying to create the requested partitions.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the connections reside. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

ConnectionNameList.description: A list of names of the connections to delete.

Errors.description: A map of the names of connections that were not successfully deleted to error details.

Succeeded.description: A list of names of the connection definitions that were successfully deleted.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the partition to be deleted resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database in which the table in question resides.

PartitionsToDelete.description: A list of PartitionInput structures that define the partitions to be deleted.

TableName.description: The name of the table where the partitions to be deleted is located.

Errors.description: Errors encountered when trying to delete the requested partitions.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the table resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database where the tables to delete reside.

TablesToDelete.description: A list of the table to delete.

Errors.description: A list of errors encountered in attempting to delete the specified tables.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the partitions in question reside. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database where the partitions reside.

PartitionsToGet.description: A list of partition values identifying the partitions to retrieve.

TableName.description: The name of the partitions' table.

Partitions.description: A list of the requested partitions.

UnprocessedKeys.description: A list of the partition values in the request for which partions were not returned.

BatchStopJobRunError.description: Details about the job run and the error that occurred while trying to submit it for stopping.

ErrorDetail.description: The details of the error that occurred.

BatchStopJobRunError.title: BatchStopJobRunError

JobName.description: The name of the job whose job runs are to be stopped.

JobRunIds.description: A list of job run Ids of the given job to be stopped.

Errors.description: A list containing the job run Ids and details of the error that occurred for each job run while submitting to stop.

SuccessfulSubmissions.description: A list of job runs which are successfully submitted for stopping.

BatchStopJobRunSuccessfulSubmission.description: Details about the job run which is submitted successfully for stopping.
BatchStopJobRunSuccessfulSubmission.title: BatchStopJobRunSuccessfulSubmission

CatalogEntry.description: Specifies a table definition in the Data Catalog.

DatabaseName.description: The database in which the table metadata resides.

TableName.description: The name of the table in question.

CatalogEntry.title: CatalogEntry

CatalogImportStatus.description: A structure containing migration status information.

ImportCompleted.description: True if the migration has completed, or False otherwise.

ImportTime.description: The time that the migration was started.

ImportedBy.description: The name of the person who initiated the migration.

CatalogImportStatus.title: CatalogImportStatus

Classifier.description: Classifiers are written in Python and triggered during a Crawl Task. You can write your own Classifiers to best categorize your data sources and specify the appropriate schemas to use for them. A Classifier first checks whether a given file is in a format it can handle, and then, if so, creates a schema in the form of a StructType object that matches that data format.
Classifier.title: Classifier

CodeGenEdge.description: Represents a directional edge in a directed acyclic graph (DAG).

Source.description: The ID of the node at which the edge starts.

Target.description: The ID of the node at which the edge ends.

CodeGenEdge.title: CodeGenEdge

CodeGenNode.description: Represents a node in a directed acyclic graph (DAG)

Args.description: Properties of the node, in the form of name-value pairs.

Id.description: A node identifier that is unique within the node's graph.

LineNumber.description: The line number of the node.

NodeType.description: The type of node this is.

CodeGenNode.title: CodeGenNode

CodeGenNodeArg.description: An argument or property of a node.

Name.description: The name of the argument or property.

Param.description: True if the value is used as a parameter.

Value.description: The value of the argument or property.

CodeGenNodeArg.title: CodeGenNodeArg

Name.description: The name of the Column.

Type.description: The datatype of data in the Column.

ConcurrentModificationException.description: Two processes are trying to modify a resource simultaneously.
ConcurrentModificationException.title: ConcurrentModificationException

ConcurrentRunsExceededException.description: Too many jobs are being run concurrently.
ConcurrentRunsExceededException.title: ConcurrentRunsExceededException

Condition.description: Defines a condition under which a trigger fires.

JobName.description: The name of the job in question.

Condition.title: Condition

Connection.description: Defines a connection to a data source.

ConnectionProperties.description: A list of key-value pairs used as parameters for this connection.

ConnectionType.description: The type of the connection. Currently, only JDBC is supported; SFTP is not supported.

CreationTime.description: The time this connection definition was created.

LastUpdatedBy.description: The user, group or role that last updated this connection definition.

LastUpdatedTime.description: The last time this connection definition was updated.

MatchCriteria.description: A list of criteria that can be used in selecting this connection.

Name.description: The name of the connection definition.

PhysicalConnectionRequirements.description: A map of physical connection requirements, such as VPC and SecurityGroup, needed for making this connection successfully.

Connection.title: Connection

ConnectionInput.description: A structure used to specify a connection to create or update.

ConnectionProperties.description: A list of key-value pairs used as parameters for this connection.

ConnectionType.description: The type of the connection. Currently, only JDBC is supported; SFTP is not supported.

MatchCriteria.description: A list of criteria that can be used in selecting this connection.

Name.description: The name of the connection.

PhysicalConnectionRequirements.description: A map of physical connection requirements, such as VPC and SecurityGroup, needed for making this connection successfully.

ConnectionInput.title: ConnectionInput

ConnectionsList.description: Specifies the connections used by a job.

Connections.description: A list of connections used by the job.

ConnectionsList.title: ConnectionsList

Crawler.description: Specifies a crawler program that examines a data source and uses classifiers to try to determine its schema. If successful, the crawler records metatdata concerning the data source in the Data Catalog.

Classifiers.description: A list of custom Classifiers associated with this Crawler.

CrawlElapsedTime.description: If this Crawler is running, contains the total time elapsed since the last crawl began.

CreationTime.description: The time when the Crawler was created.

DatabaseName.description: The Database where this Crawler's output should be stored.

Description.description: A description of this Crawler and where it should be used.

LastCrawl.description: The status of the last crawl, and potentially error information if an error occurred.

LastUpdated.description: The time the Crawler was last updated.

Name.description: The Crawler name.

Role.description: The IAM role (or ARN of an IAM role) used to access customer resources such as data in S3.

Schedule.description: A Schedule object that specifies the schedule on which this Crawler is to be run.

SchemaChangePolicy.description: Sets policy for the crawler's update and delete behavior.

State.description: Indicates whether this Crawler is running, or whether a run is pending.

TablePrefix.description: The table prefix used for catalog tables created.

Targets.description: A collection of targets to crawl.

Crawler.title: Crawler

LastRuntimeSeconds.description: The duration of the crawler's most recent run, in seconds.

MedianRuntimeSeconds.description: The median duration of this crawler's runs, in seconds.

StillEstimating.description: True if the crawler is estimating its

TablesCreated.description: A list of the tables created by this crawler.

TablesDeleted.description: A list of the tables deleted by this crawler.

TablesUpdated.description: A list of the tables created by this crawler.

TimeLeftSeconds.description: The estimated time left to complete a running crawl.

CrawlerNotRunningException.description: The specified crawler is not running.
CrawlerNotRunningException.title: CrawlerNotRunningException

CrawlerRunningException.description: The operation cannot be performed because the crawler is already running.
CrawlerRunningException.title: CrawlerRunningException

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which to create the connection. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

ConnectionInput.description: A ConnectionInput object defining the connection to create.

Classifiers.description: A list of custom Classifier names that the user has registered. By default, all AWS classifiers are included in a crawl, but these custom classifiers always override the default classifiers for a given classification.

DatabaseName.description: The Glue Database where results will be stored, such as: arn:aws:daylight:us-east-1::database/sometable/*.

Name.description: Name of the new Crawler.

Role.description: The IAM role (or ARN of an IAM role) used by the new Crawler to access customer resources.

Schedule.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

SchemaChangePolicy.description: Policy for the crawler's update and deletion behavior.

TablePrefix.description: The table prefix used for catalog tables created.

Targets.description: A list of collection of targets to crawl.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which to create the database. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseInput.description: A DatabaseInput object defining the metadata database to create in the catalog.

EndpointName.description: The name to be assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

ExtraJarsS3Path.description: Path to one or more Java Jars in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

ExtraPythonLibsS3Path.description:
Path(s) to one or more Python libraries in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint. Multiple values must be complete paths separated by a comma.

Please note that only pure Python libraries can currently be used on a DevEndpoint. Libraries that rely on C extensions, such as the pandas Python data analysis library, are not yet supported.

NumberOfNodes.description: The number of AWS Glue Data Processing Units (DPUs) to allocate to this DevEndpoint.

PublicKey.description: The public key to use for authentication.

RoleArn.description: The IAM role for the DevEndpoint.

SecurityGroupIds.description: Security group IDs for the security groups to be used by the new DevEndpoint.

SubnetId.description: The subnet ID for the new DevEndpoint to use.

AvailabilityZone.description: The AWS availability zone where this DevEndpoint is located.

CreatedTimestamp.description: The point in time at which this DevEndpoint was created.

EndpointName.description: The name assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

ExtraJarsS3Path.description: Path to one or more Java Jars in an S3 bucket that will be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

ExtraPythonLibsS3Path.description: Path(s) to one or more Python libraries in an S3 bucket that will be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

FailureReason.description: The reason for a current failure in this DevEndpoint.

NumberOfNodes.description: The number of AWS Glue Data Processing Units (DPUs) allocated to this DevEndpoint.

RoleArn.description: The AWS ARN of the role assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The security groups assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

Status.description: The current status of the new DevEndpoint.

SubnetId.description: The subnet ID assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

VpcId.description: The ID of the VPC used by this DevEndpoint.

YarnEndpointAddress.description: The address of the YARN endpoint used by this DevEndpoint.

ZeppelinRemoteSparkInterpreterPort.description: The Apache Zeppelin port for the remote Apache Spark interpreter.

Classification.description: The type of result that the classifier matches, such as Twitter Json, Omniture logs, Cloudwatch logs, and so forth.

CustomPatterns.description: Custom grok patterns used by this classifier.

Name.description: The name of the new Classifier.

Connections.description: The connections used for this job.

Name.description: The name to assign to the new trigger.

Schedule.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

Type.description: The type of the new trigger.

Name.description: The name assigned to the new trigger.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database in which to create the function.

FunctionInput.description: A FunctionInput object that defines the function to create in the Data Catalog.

Database.description: The Database object represents a logical grouping of tables that may reside in a Hive metastore or an RDBMS.

LocationUri.description: The location of the database (for example, an HDFS path).

Parameters.description: A list of key-value pairs that define parameters and properties of the database.

DevEndpoint.description: A development endpoint where a developer can remotely debug ETL scripts.

AvailabilityZone.description: The AWS availability zone where this DevEndpoint is located.

CreatedTimestamp.description: The point in time at which this DevEndpoint was created.

ExtraJarsS3Path.description:
Path to one or more Java Jars in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

Please note that only pure Java/Scala libraries can currently be used on a DevEndpoint.

ExtraPythonLibsS3Path.description:
Path(s) to one or more Python libraries in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint. Multiple values must be complete paths separated by a comma.

Please note that only pure Python libraries can currently be used on a DevEndpoint. Libraries that rely on C extensions, such as the pandas Python data analysis library, are not yet supported.

FailureReason.description: The reason for a current failure in this DevEndpoint.

LastModifiedTimestamp.description: The point in time at which this DevEndpoint was last modified.

LastUpdateStatus.description: The status of the last update.

NumberOfNodes.description: The number of AWS Glue Data Processing Units (DPUs) allocated to this DevEndpoint.

PublicAddress.description: The public address used by this DevEndpoint.

PublicKey.description: The public key to be used by this DevEndpoint for authentication.

RoleArn.description: The AWS ARN of the IAM role used in this DevEndpoint.

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list of security group identifiers used in this DevEndpoint.

Status.description: The current status of this DevEndpoint.

SubnetId.description: The subnet ID for this DevEndpoint.

VpcId.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) used by this DevEndpoint.

YarnEndpointAddress.description: The YARN endpoint address used by this DevEndpoint.

ZeppelinRemoteSparkInterpreterPort.description: The Apache Zeppelin port for the remote Apache Spark interpreter.

DevEndpoint.title: DevEndpoint

Path to one or more Java Jars in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

ExtraPythonLibsS3Path.description:
Path(s) to one or more Python libraries in an S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint. Multiple values must be complete paths separated by a comma.

Please note that only pure Python libraries can currently be used on a DevEndpoint. Libraries that rely on C extensions, such as the pandas Python data analysis library, are not yet supported.

DevEndpointCustomLibraries.title: DevEndpointCustomLibraries

NextToken.description: A continuation token, if this is a continuation call.

JobRun.description: Contains information about a job run.

PredecessorRuns.description: A list of predecessors to this job run.

PreviousRunId.description: The ID of the previous run of this job.

StartedOn.description: The date and time at which this job run was started.

TriggerName.description: The name of the trigger for this job run.

JobRun.title: JobRun

JobUpdate.description: Specifies information used to update an existing job.

AllocatedCapacity.description: The number of capacity units allocated to this job.

Command.description: The JobCommand that executes this job.

Connections.description: The connections used for this job.

DefaultArguments.description: The default parameters for this job.

ExecutionProperty.description: An ExecutionProperty specifying the maximum number of concurrent runs allowed for this job.

LogUri.description: This field is reserved for future use.

MaxRetries.description: The maximum number of times to retry this job if it fails.

Role.description: The role associated with this job.

JobUpdate.title: JobUpdate

LastCrawlInfo.description: Status and error information about the most recent crawl.

ErrorMessage.description: Error information about the last crawl, if an error occurred.

LogGroup.description: The log group for the last crawl.

LogStream.description: The log stream for the last crawl.

MessagePrefix.description: The prefix for a message about this crawl.

StartTime.description: The time at which the crawl started.

LastCrawlInfo.title: LastCrawlInfo

SourceTable.description: The name of the source table.

Order.description: Specifies the sort order of a sorted column.

SortOrder.description: Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order (== 1), or in descending order (==0).

Order.title: Order

Partition.description: Represents a slice of table data.

CreationTime.description: The time at which the partition was created.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database where the table in question is located.

LastAccessTime.description: The last time at which the partition was accessed.

LastAnalyzedTime.description: The last time at which column statistics were computed for this partition.

Parameters.description: Partition parameters, in the form of a list of key-value pairs.

StorageDescriptor.description: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

TableName.description: The name of the table in question.

Partition.title: Partition

PartitionError.description: Contains information about a partition error.

PartitionValues.description: The values that define the partition.

PartitionError.title: PartitionError

PartitionInput.description: The structure used to create and update a partion.

LastAccessTime.description: The last time at which the partition was accessed.

LastAnalyzedTime.description: The last time at which column statistics were computed for this partition.

Parameters.description: Partition parameters, in the form of a list of key-value pairs.

StorageDescriptor.description: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

PartitionInput.title: PartitionInput

PartitionValueList.description: Contains a list of values defining partitions.
PartitionValueList.title: PartitionValueList

PhysicalConnectionRequirements.description: Specifies the physical requirements for a connection.

SecurityGroupIdList.description: The security group ID list used by the connection.

SubnetId.description: The subnet ID used by the connection.

PhysicalConnectionRequirements.title: PhysicalConnectionRequirements

Predecessor.description: A job run that preceded this one.

JobName.description: The name of the predecessor job.

RunId.description: The job-run ID of the precessor job run.

Predecessor.title: Predecessor

Predicate.description: Defines the predicate of the trigger, which determines when it fires.

Conditions.description: A list of the conditions that determine when the trigger will fire.

Predicate.title: Predicate

JobName.description: The name of the job in question.

ResourceNumberLimitExceededException.description: A resource numerical limit was exceeded.
ResourceNumberLimitExceededException.title: ResourceNumberLimitExceededException

Uri.description: The URI for accessing the resource.

S3Target.description: Specifies a crawler target in AWS S3.

Exclusions.description: A list of S3 objects to exclude from the crawl.

Path.description: The path to the S3 target.

S3Target.title: S3Target

Schedule.description: A scheduling object using a cron statement to schedule an event.

ScheduleExpression.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

Schedule.title: Schedule

SchedulerNotRunningException.description: The specified scheduler is not running.
SchedulerNotRunningException.title: SchedulerNotRunningException

SchedulerRunningException.description: The specified scheduler is already running.
SchedulerRunningException.title: SchedulerRunningException

SchemaChangePolicy.description: Crawler policy for update and deletion behavior.
SchemaChangePolicy.title: SchemaChangePolicy

Segment.description: Defines a non-overlapping region of a table's partitions, allowing multiple requests to be executed in parallel.

SegmentNumber.description: The zero-based index number of the this segment. For example, if the total number of segments is 4, SegmentNumber values will range from zero through three.

Segment.title: Segment

SerDeInfo.description: Information about a serialization/deserialization program (SerDe) which serves as an extractor and loader.

Name.description: Name of the SerDe.

Parameters.description: A list of initialization parameters for the SerDe, in key-value form.

SerializationLibrary.description: Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is: org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe.

SerDeInfo.title: SerDeInfo

SkewedInfo.description: Specifies skewed values in a table. Skewed are ones that occur with very high frequency.

SkewedColumnNames.description: A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.

SkewedColumnValueLocationMaps.description: A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.

SkewedColumnValues.description: A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.

SkewedInfo.title: SkewedInfo

Name.description: Name of the Crawler to start.

CrawlerName.description: Name of the crawler to schedule.

AllocatedCapacity.description: The infrastructure capacity to allocate to this job.

Arguments.description: Specific arguments for this job run.

JobName.description: The name of the job to start.

JobRunId.description: The ID of the job run to start.
The ID assigned to this job run.

Name.description: The name of the trigger to start.
The name of the trigger that was started.
Name of the Crawler to stop.

CrawlerName.description: Name of the crawler whose schedule state to set.

Name.description: The name of the trigger to stop.
The name of the trigger that was stopped.

StorageDescriptor.description: Describes the physical storage of table data.

BucketColumns.description: A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.

Columns.description: A list of the Columns in the table.

Compressed.description: True if the data in the table is compressed, or False if not.

InputFormat.description: The input format: SequenceFileInputFormat (binary), or TextInputFormat, or a custom format.

Location.description: The physical location of the table. By default this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

NumberOfBuckets.description: Must be specified if the table contains any dimension columns.

OutputFormat.description: The output format: SequenceFileOutputFormat (binary), or IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat, or a custom format.

SkewedInfo.description: Information about values that appear very frequently in a column (skewed values).

SortColumns.description: A list specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

StoredAsSubDirectories.description: True if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or False if not.

StorageDescriptor.title: StorageDescriptor

Table.description: Represents a collection of related data organized in columns and rows.

CreateTime.description: Time when the table definition was created in the Data Catalog.

CreatedBy.description: Person or entity who created the table.

DatabaseName.description: Name of the metadata database where the table metadata resides.

LastAccessTime.description: Last time the table was accessed. This is usually taken from HDFS, and may not be reliable.

LastAnalyzedTime.description: Last time column statistics were computed for this table.

Name.description: Name of the table.

Parameters.description: Properties associated with this table, as a list of key-value pairs.

PartitionKeys.description: A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

StorageDescriptor.description: A storage descriptor containing information about the physical storage of this table.

TableType.description: The type of this table (EXTERNAL_TABLE, VIRTUAL_VIEW, etc.).

UpdateTime.description: Last time the table was updated.

ViewExpandedText.description: If the table is a view, the expanded text of the view; otherwise null.

ViewOriginalText.description: If the table is a view, the original text of the view; otherwise null.

Table.title: Table

TableError.description: An error record for table operations.
TableError.title: TableError

TableInput.description: Structure used to create or update the table.

LastAccessTime.description: Last time the table was accessed.

LastAnalyzedTime.description: Last time column statistics were computed for this table.

Name.description: Name of the table.

Parameters.description: Properties associated with this table, as a list of key-value pairs.

PartitionKeys.description: A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

StorageDescriptor.description: A storage descriptor containing information about the physical storage of this table.

TableType.description: The type of this table (EXTERNAL_TABLE, VIRTUAL_VIEW, etc.).

ViewExpandedText.description: If the table is a view, the expanded text of the view; otherwise null.

ViewOriginalText.description: If the table is a view, the original text of the view; otherwise null.

TableInput.title: TableInput

TableVersion.description: Specifies a version of a table.

VersionId.description: The ID value that identifies this table version.

TableVersion.title: TableVersion

Actions.description: The actions initiated by this trigger.

Name.description: Name of the trigger.

Schedule.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

State.description: The current state of the trigger.

Type.description: The type of trigger that this is.

TriggerUpdate.description: A structure used to provide information used to updata a trigger.

Actions.description: The actions initiated by this trigger.

Name.description: The name of the trigger.

Predicate.description: The predicate of this trigger, which defines when it will fire.

Schedule.description: An updated cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

TriggerUpdate.title: TriggerUpdate

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the connection resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

ConnectionInput.description: A ConnectionInput object that redefines the connection in question.

Name.description: The name of the connection definition to update.

Classifiers.description: A list of custom Classifier names that the user has registered. By default, all AWS classifiers are included in a crawl, but these custom classifiers always override the default classifiers for a given classification.

DatabaseName.description: The Glue Database where results will be stored, such as: arn:aws:daylight:us-east-1::database/sometable/*.

Name.description: Name of the new Crawler.

Role.description: The IAM role (or ARN of an IAM role) used by the new Crawler to access customer resources.

Schedule.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

SchemaChangePolicy.description: Policy for the crawler's update and deletion behavior.

TablePrefix.description: The table prefix used for catalog tables created.

Targets.description: A list of collection of targets to crawl.

CrawlerName.description: Name of the crawler whose schedule to update.

Schedule.description: The updated cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the metadata database resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseInput.description: A DatabaseInput object specifying the new definition of the metadata database in the catalog.

Name.description: The name of the metadata database to update in the catalog.

CustomLibraries.description: Custom Python or Java libraries to be loaded in the DevEndpoint.

EndpointName.description: The name of the DevEndpoint to be updated.

PublicKey.description: The public key for the DevEndpoint to use.

UpdateEtlLibraries.description: True if the list of custom libraries to be loaded in the development endpoint needs to be updated, or False otherwise.

UpdateGrokClassifierRequest.description: Specifies a Grok classifier to update when passed to UpdateClassifier.

Classification.description: The type of result that the classifier matches, such as Twitter Json, Omniture logs, Cloudwatch logs, and so forth.

CustomPatterns.description: Custom grok patterns used by this classifier.

GrokPattern.description: The grok pattern used by this classifier.

Name.description: The name of the GrokClassifier.

UpdateGrokClassifierRequest.title: UpdateGrokClassifierRequest

JobName.description: Name of the job definition to update.

JobUpdate.description: Specifies the values with which to update the job.

JobName.description: Returns the name of the updated job.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the partition to be updated resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database in which the table in question resides.

PartitionInput.description: The new partition object to which to update the partition.

PartitionValueList.description: A list of the values defining the partition.

TableName.description: The name of the table where the partition to be updated is located.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the table resides. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database in which the table resides.

TableInput.description: An updated TableInput object to define the metadata table in the catalog.

Name.description: The name of the trigger to update.

TriggerUpdate.description: The new values with which to update the trigger.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog where the function to be updated is located. If none is supplied, the AWS account ID is used by default.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database where the function to be updated is located.

FunctionInput.description: A FunctionInput object that re-defines the function in the Data Catalog.

UserDefinedFunction.description: Represents the equivalent of a Hive user-defined function (UDF) definition.

ClassName.description: The Java class that contains the function code.

CreateTime.description: The time at which the function was created.

ResourceUris.description: The resource URIs for the function.

UserDefinedFunction.title: UserDefinedFunction

UserDefinedFunctionInput.description: A structure used to create or updata a user-defined function.

ClassName.description: The Java class that contains the function code.

ResourceUris.description: The resource URIs for the function.

UserDefinedFunctionInput.title: UserDefinedFunctionInput

ValidationException.description: A value could not be validated.
ValidationException.title: ValidationException
